body:
# pdns.cr

pdns.cr provides a crystal api to interact with the JSON API of PowerDNS

## Installation

1. Add the dependency to your `shard.yml`:

```yaml
dependencies:
 pdns:
   github: repomaa/pdns
```

2. Run `shards install`

## Usage

### Creating an API Instance

```crystal
require "pdns"

api = Pdns::API.new("https://your-pdns.tld", "your-api-key")
```

### Listing servers

```crystal
pp api.servers.list
```

### Listing zones on a server

```crystal
api.servers.with("localhost") do |server|
  pp server.zones.list
end
```

### Editing a zone

```crystal
api.servers.with("localhost") do |server|
  server.zones.edit_rrsets("my-domain.tld.") do |rrsets|
    # delete all CNAMEs
    rrsets.select(&.type.cname?).each(&.delete!)

    # modify a resource record set
    rrset = rrsets.find do |rrset|
      rrset.type.a? && rrset.name == "www.my-domain.tld."
    end

    raise "No such A record" if rrset.nil?

    rrset.records = [Pdns::Record.new("127.0.0.1")]
    rrset.replace!

    # add a record
    rrsets << Pdns::RRSet.new(
      name: "www.my-domain.tld.",
      type: Pdns::DNSRecordType::AAAA,
      ttl: 3600_u32,
      records: [Pdns::Record.new("::1")],
    )
  end
end
```

### Listing cryptokeys in a zone on a server

```crystal
api.servers.with("localhost") do |server|
  server.zones.with("my-domain.tld.") do |zone|
    zone.cryptokeys.list
  end
end
```

### Adding a cryptokey to a zone on a server

```crystal
api.servers.with("localhost") do |server|
  server.zones.with("my-domain.tld.") do |zone|
    key = Pdns::Cryptokey.new(
      key_type: "csk",
      bits: 256_u16
    )
    zone.cryptokeys.create(key)
  end
end
```

See [the documentation](https://repomaa.github.io/pdns.cr) for more information.
Especially the `Pdns::API::Endpoint`. Most endpoints are scoped under either
`Pdns::API::Endpoints::Servers` or `Pdns::API::Endpoints::Zones` (which is in turn
scoped under `Pdns::API::Endpoints::Servers`). You can access the scoped
endpoints by using the `#with(id)` method of an endpoint. It will be passed as a
block variable.

## Contributing

1. Fork it (<https://github.com/repomaa/pdns.cr/fork>)
2. Create your feature branch (`git checkout -b my-new-feature`)
3. Commit your changes (`git commit -am 'Add some feature'`)
4. Push to the branch (`git push origin my-new-feature`)
5. Create a new Pull Request

## Contributors

- [Joakim Repomaa](https://github.com/repomaa) - creator and maintainer

types.name: Pdns
types.doc: A library to interface with the JSON api of PowerDNS
types.summary: A library to interface with the JSON api of PowerDNS

def.name: endpoint
scoped
def.body:
class Scoped
        def initialize(@api : API, @base_path : String)
        
end
      
end

      
{{ yield }}


      def with(id : String, &block : Scoped -> T) : T forall T
        yield Scoped.new(@api, "#{@base_path}/#{id}/")
      
end

instance_methods.name: flush
instance_methods.doc:
Flush a cache-entry by name

*domain*: The domain name to flush from the cache

instance_methods.name: activate
instance_methods.doc: This method activates a key from zone_name specified by cryptokey_id
instance_methods.summary: This method activates a key from zone_name specified by cryptokey_id

instance_methods.name: create
instance_methods.doc:
Creates a Cryptokey

This method adds a new key to a zone. The key can either be generated
or imported by supplying the *private_key* parameter of the given
`Cryptokey`.

if *private_key*, *bits* and *algorithm* aren't set, a key will be
generated based on the `default-ksk-algorithm` and `default-ksk-size`
settings for a `"ksk"` *key_type* and the `default-zsk-algorithm` and
`default-zsk-size` options for a `"zsk"` *key_type*.

instance_methods.name: deactivate
instance_methods.doc: This method deactivates a key from zone_name specified by cryptokey_id
instance_methods.summary: This method deactivates a key from zone_name specified by cryptokey_id

instance_methods.name: delete
instance_methods.doc: This method deletes a key specified by cryptokey_id.
instance_methods.summary: This method deletes a key specified by cryptokey_id.

instance_methods.name: get
instance_methods.doc: Returns all data about the CryptoKey, including the privatekey.
instance_methods.summary: Returns all data about the CryptoKey, including the privatekey.

instance_methods.name: list
instance_methods.doc: Get all CryptoKeys for a zone, except the privatekey
instance_methods.summary: Get all CryptoKeys for a zone, except the privatekey

instance_methods.name: create
instance_methods.doc: Creates a set of metadata entries

instance_methods.name: delete
instance_methods.doc: Delete all items of a single kind of domain metadata.
instance_methods.summary: Delete all items of a single kind of domain metadata.

instance_methods.name: edit
instance_methods.doc: Replace the content of a single kind of domain metadata.
instance_methods.summary: Replace the content of a single kind of domain metadata.

def.name: edit
def.body:
metadata = get(kind)
yield metadata
put("/#{kind}", Pdns::Metadata, metadata)

instance_methods.name: get
instance_methods.doc: Get the content of a single kind of domain metadata as a Metadata object.
instance_methods.summary: Get the content of a single kind of domain metadata as a Metadata object.

instance_methods.name: list
instance_methods.doc: Get all the Metadata associated with the zone.
instance_methods.summary: Get all the Metadata associated with the zone.

instance_methods.name: search
instance_methods.doc:
Search the data inside PowerDNS

Search the data inside PowerDNS for *query* and return at most *max*
results. This includes zones, records and comments. The `*` character
can be used in *query* as a wildcard character and the `?` character
can be used as a wildcard for a single character.
instance_methods.args_string: (query : String, *, max : Int32? = nil, object_type : String? = nil) : Array(SearchResult)

def.name: search
def.body: get("/", Array(SearchResult), q: query, max: max, object_type: object_type)

instance_methods.name: get
instance_methods.doc: List a server

instance_methods.name: list
instance_methods.doc: List all servers

instance_methods.name: with
instance_methods.args_string: (id : String, &block : Scoped -> T) : T forall T

instance_methods.name: query
instance_methods.doc:
Query statistics.

Query PowerDNS internal statistics.

*statistic* - When set to the name of a specific statistic, only this
value is returned. If no statistic with that name exists, the method
raise an error.

*include_rings* - whether to include the Ring items, which can contain
thousands of log messages or queried domains. Setting this to `false`
may make the response a lot smaller.
instance_methods.args_string: (*, statistic : String? = nil, include_rings : Bool? = nil) : Array(StatisticItem | MapStatisticItem | RingStatisticItem)

def.name: query
def.body: get("/", Array(StatisticItem | MapStatisticItem | RingStatisticItem), statistic: statistic, includerings: include_rings)

Add a TSIG key

This methods add a new TSIG Key. The actual key can be generated by the
server or be provided by the client

*rrsets* - set to `false` to exclude rrsets from the response

def.body: post("/", Zone, body: zone, rrsets: rrsets)

instance_methods.name: delete
instance_methods.doc: Deletes this zone, all attached metadata and rrsets.
instance_methods.summary: Deletes this zone, all attached metadata and rrsets.

instance_methods.name: edit_metadata
instance_methods.doc:
Modifies basic zone data (metadata).

NOTE: Switching *dnssec* to `true` (from `false`) sets up DNSSEC
signing based on the other flags, this includes running the equivalent
of `secure-zone` and `rectify-zone` (if *api_rectify* is set to
`true`). This also applies to newly created zones. If *presigned* is
true, no DNSSEC changes will be made to the zone or cryptokeys.

def.name: edit_metadata
def.body:
zone = get(id)
yield zone
patched_zone = Zone.new(name: nil, kind: zone.kind, masters: zone.masters, dnssec: zone.dnssec, nsec3param: zone.nsec3param, nsec3narrow: zone.nsec3narrow?, presigned: zone.presigned?, soa_edit: zone.soa_edit, soa_edit_api: zone.soa_edit_api, api_rectify: zone.api_rectify?, account: zone.account, nameservers: zone.nameservers, master_tsig_key_ids: zone.master_tsig_key_ids, slave_tsig_key_ids: zone.slave_tsig_key_ids)
put("/#{id}", Nil, patched_zone)

instance_methods.name: edit_rrsets
instance_methods.doc:
Creates/modifies/deletes `RRSet`s

Make sure to call `delete!` or `replace!` on existing `RRSet`s

def.name: edit_rrsets
def.body:
zone = get(id)
rrsets = zone.rrsets || ([] of RRSet)
yield rrsets
patched_zone = Zone.new(name: nil, kind: nil, rrsets: rrsets.select(&.changetype))
patch("/#{id}", Nil, patched_zone)

instance_methods.name: export
instance_methods.doc: Returns the zone in AXFR format.

instance_methods.summary: Get a zone managed by a server

instance_methods.name: notify
instance_methods.doc:
Send a DNS NOTIFY to all slaves.

Fails when zone kind is not Master or Slave, or master and slave are
disabled in the configuration. Only works for Slave if renotify is on.
instance_methods.summary: Send a DNS NOTIFY to all slaves.

instance_methods.name: rectify
instance_methods.doc:
Rectify the zone data.

This does not take into account the API-RECTIFY metadata. Fails on
slave zones and zones that do not have DNSSEC.

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(content: content, account: account, modified_at: modified_at)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.body:
if (value = @algorithm).nil?
  ::raise(NilAssertionError.new("Pdns::Cryptokey#algorithm cannot be nil"))
else
  value
end

types.name: RRSet
types.doc:
This represents a Resource Record Set (all records with the same name and
type).
types.summary: This represents a Resource Record Set (all records with the same name and type).

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Initialize an RRSet with the given attributes

```
RRSet.new(
  name: "www.powerdns.com.",
  type: "A",
  ttl: 3600_u32,
  records: [Record.new("127.0.0.1")],
  comments: [Comment.new(content: "Testing", account: "Tester")]
)
```
constructors.summary: Initialize an RRSet with the given attributes
constructors.args_string: (*, name, type, changetype = ChangeType::Replace, ttl = nil, records = nil, comments = nil)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(name: name, type: type, changetype: changetype, ttl: ttl, records: records, comments: comments)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: changetype
instance_methods.doc:
MUST be added when updating the RRSet. Must be `ChangeType::Replace` or
`ChangeType::Delete`.

With `ChangeType::Delete`, all existing RRs matching name and type will
be deleted, including all comments.

With `ChangeType::Replace`: when records is present, all existing RRs
matching name and type will be deleted, and then new records given in
records will be created.  If no records are left, any existing comments
will be deleted as well.  When comments is present, all existing comments
for the RRs matching name and type will be deleted, and then new comments
given in comments will be created.
instance_methods.summary: MUST be added when updating the RRSet.

instance_methods.name: changetype=
instance_methods.doc:
MUST be added when updating the RRSet. Must be `ChangeType::Replace` or
`ChangeType::Delete`.

With `ChangeType::Delete`, all existing RRs matching name and type will
be deleted, including all comments.

With `ChangeType::Replace`: when records is present, all existing RRs
matching name and type will be deleted, and then new records given in
records will be created.  If no records are left, any existing comments
will be deleted as well.  When comments is present, all existing comments
for the RRs matching name and type will be deleted, and then new comments
given in comments will be created.
instance_methods.summary: MUST be added when updating the RRSet.

instance_methods.name: comments
instance_methods.doc:
List of Comment.

Must be empty when changetype is set to DELETE. An empty list results in
deletion of all comments. modified_at is optional and defaults to the
current server time.

instance_methods.name: comments=
instance_methods.doc:
List of Comment.

Must be empty when changetype is set to DELETE. An empty list results in
deletion of all comments. modified_at is optional and defaults to the
current server time.

instance_methods.name: delete!
instance_methods.doc: Sets changetype to `ChangeType::Delete`

instance_methods.name: name
instance_methods.doc: Name for record set (e.g. "www.powerdns.com.")

instance_methods.name: name=
instance_methods.doc: Name for record set (e.g. "www.powerdns.com.")

instance_methods.name: records
instance_methods.doc:
All records in this RRSet.

When updating Records, this is the list of new records (replacing the old
ones). Must be empty when changetype is set to `"DELETE"`. An empty list
results in deletion of all records (and comments).

instance_methods.name: records=
instance_methods.doc:
All records in this RRSet.

When updating Records, this is the list of new records (replacing the old
ones). Must be empty when changetype is set to `"DELETE"`. An empty list
results in deletion of all records (and comments).

instance_methods.name: replace!
instance_methods.doc: Sets changetype to `ChangeType::Replace`

instance_methods.name: ttl
instance_methods.doc:
DNS TTL of the records, in seconds.
MUST NOT be included when changetype is set to "DELETE”.
instance_methods.summary: DNS TTL of the records, in seconds.

instance_methods.name: ttl=
instance_methods.doc:
DNS TTL of the records, in seconds.
MUST NOT be included when changetype is set to "DELETE”.
instance_methods.summary: DNS TTL of the records, in seconds.

instance_methods.name: type
instance_methods.doc: Type of this record (e.g. "A", "PTR", "MX")

instance_methods.name: type=
instance_methods.doc: Type of this record (e.g. "A", "PTR", "MX")

instance_methods.name: config_url
instance_methods.doc: The API endpoint for this server’s configuration
instance_methods.summary: The API endpoint for this server’s configuration

instance_methods.name: daemon_type
instance_methods.doc: "recursor" for the PowerDNS Recursor and "authoritative" for the Authoritative Server
instance_methods.summary: "recursor" for the PowerDNS Recursor and "authoritative" for the Authoritative Server

instance_methods.name: id
instance_methods.doc: The id of the server, "localhost"

instance_methods.name: type
instance_methods.doc: Set to "Server"

instance_methods.name: url
instance_methods.doc: The API endpoint for this server

instance_methods.name: version
instance_methods.doc: The version of the server software

instance_methods.name: zones_url
instance_methods.doc: The API endpoint for this server’s zones
instance_methods.summary: The API endpoint for this server’s zones

instance_methods.doc: Item name

types.name: Zone
types.doc: This represents an authoritative DNS Zone.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Initialize a new Zone with the given attributes

```
Zone.new(
  name: "powerdns.com.",
  kind: Zone::Kind::Master,
  rrsets: [
    RRSet.new(
      name: "www.powerdns.com.",
      kind: Zone::Kind::Native,
      type: "A",
      ttl: 3600_u16,
      changetype: "REPLACE",
      records: [Record.new("127.0.0.1")],
    ),
  ],
  soa_edit_api: "DEFAULT",
)
```
constructors.summary: Initialize a new Zone with the given attributes
constructors.args_string: (*, name, kind, rrsets = [] of RRSet, masters = nil, dnssec = nil, nsec3param = nil, nsec3narrow = nil, presigned = nil, soa_edit = nil, soa_edit_api = nil, api_rectify = nil, zone = nil, account = nil, nameservers = [] of String, master_tsig_key_ids = nil, slave_tsig_key_ids = nil)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(name: name, kind: kind, rrsets: rrsets, masters: masters, dnssec: dnssec, nsec3param: nsec3param, nsec3narrow: nsec3narrow, presigned: presigned, soa_edit: soa_edit, soa_edit_api: soa_edit_api, api_rectify: api_rectify, zone: zone, account: account, nameservers: nameservers, master_tsig_key_ids: master_tsig_key_ids, slave_tsig_key_ids: slave_tsig_key_ids)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: account
instance_methods.doc: MAY be set. Its value is defined by local policy

instance_methods.name: account=
instance_methods.doc: MAY be set. Its value is defined by local policy

instance_methods.doc:
The SOA serial as seen in query responses.
Calculated using the SOA-EDIT metadata,
default-soa-edit and default-soa-edit-signed settings
instance_methods.summary: The SOA serial as seen in query responses.

def.name: edited_serial
def.body:
if (value = @edited_serial).nil?
  ::raise(NilAssertionError.new("Pdns::Zone#edited_serial cannot be nil"))
else
  value
end

MAY be sent in client bodies during creation,

including the trailing dot.
Not required for slave zones.
